Train my brain to anticipate danger: Since I cannot feel physical sensations, I would train my brain to anticipate potential dangers and react accordingly. This could involve using visual and auditory cues to detect potential threats and take action. Confidence score: 0.9

Develop a heightened sense of awareness: I would focus on developing a heightened sense of awareness and intuition to detect potential dangers. This could involve practicing mindfulness and meditation to increase my mental acuity and reactivity. Confidence score: 0.8

Use artificial limbs with sensory feedback: If I lost my ability to feel physical sensations, I would use artificial limbs that are equipped with sensory feedback. This would allow me to still feel sensations such as touch, pressure, and temperature, and react accordingly. Confidence score: 0.9
